intro: Tagetes cabrerae, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has feathery, aromatic leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also have historical uses in traditional medicine.
